attributes.action: Amend driving licences to remove the unnecessary title from women's licences.
attributes.background: UK driving licences betray a clear and unwarranted gender bias. Men's driving licences are in their name without a title: John Smith. Women's driving licences contain a title: Miss Joan Smith. There is no reason for this. Someone's marital or academic status has no impact on their ability to drive.

attributes.action: Allow student nurses to receive the 30 hours funding for childcare
attributes.background: Student nurses don't get enough money to cover childcare costs. The 30 hours funding is only available to people who earn 120pw but it is not fair that student nurses have to work 37.5 hours at placement then work 2 days to meet this criteria

attributes.action: Enforce Vets to report Alabama Rot cases/location-fine the Vets if not.
attributes.background: Dylan died with Alabama Rot & we have heard of other unconfirmed cases in other local areas. We were told Dylan's case didn't need to be reported as he had a trace of New Forest Syndrome (the same as Alabama Rot) & he died of Vasculitus (Alabama Rot caused the Kidney Failure).
attributes.additional_details:
Alabama rot (CRGV) is a fatal condition in in 9 out of 10 dogs. The initial symptoms are skin lesions on the legs, chest and abdomen followed by renal involvement.
This information can be found on the Alabama Rot website and on your browser as this will bring up numerous cases which have been found throughout the country.  
Dylan's lesions started on his abdomen, he stopped eating (which was very unlike him as he loved his food) and was sleeping all of the time. 
How many cases have gone unreported?  
How many areas are infected that we are unaware of? Vets are only morally obliged to report cases.
Can this be called Dylan's Law if passed?

attributes.action: Get the transport secretary to review the C2C rail contract.
attributes.background: Since Trentalia took over the C2C contract the service has become so bad it is directly affecting customers lives. Frequent train malfunctions, delays and staff on the social media channels lying to the customers about being able to claim delay repay are rendering the service unusable.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the things C2C customers have suffered from of late include:

- Being ejected at stations like Barking or Upminster with no explanation.
- Being lied to that delay repay covers your total journey when the online system ONLY takes into account train time.
- Broken trains on a regular basis.
- Cancelled trains on a regular basis.
- Shortened trains every day since last summer.
- Delays on a weekly basis that do not 'qualify' for a refund.

attributes.action: Make lymph sparing liposuction for lipedema available on the NHS
attributes.background: Lipedema/lipoedema is a fat disorder- affecting around 11% of the female population.  While some ladies are able to get the needed treatment (postcode lottery anyone?), the majority are left out in the cold by the NHS.  The condition is painful and progressive, and these ladies need help.
attributes.additional_details:
Lipedema is quite unknown, and the only known treatment to reduce the fatty build up, is lymph sparing liposuction.  The NHS states this (https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/lipoedema/) but class treatment as cosmetic. 

Untreated, lipedema can then progress and become lipo-lymphema - lymphedema is currently treated with liposuction under the NHS.  Ladies should not have to progress to this stage before they're offered treatment!

Please help us get the treatment we need.

http://www.lipoedema.co.uk/

attributes.action: include The Baha'i Faith as part of the Religious Studies Syllabus in Schools.
attributes.background:
The Baha'i Faith is the world's youngest religion. It is only 173 years old.

It brings all other major religions together and is based on Unity of Mankind.

It makes sense! and can potentially save a lot of conflicts in the world.
attributes.additional_details:
www.bahai.org

There are over 6 million Baha'is in the world and the interesting concept is that they come from all sorts of backgrounds.

attributes.action: For All prisons in the Uk to become 'Autism friendly'
attributes.background: There is very little training in prisons for officers/ staff to recognise and support Autistic adults  entering the prison and  serving  their sentence. Only one prison in the UK called Feltham, has been Autism accredited and has made such a huge impact on supporting Autistic prisoners .

attributes.action: Create a Minister for Men that operates separately from the Minister for Women
attributes.background:
A 'Minister for Women (and Equalities)' cannot simultaneously be a 'Minister for Men' yet, that is what's in place.
Despite men raising issues in Parliament, men's issues are not raised.
A male-specific voice is required, equality demands it!
attributes.additional_details:
Such issues for the Minister for Men to address:
Paternity Rights (or, the lack of!)
Male Suicide (4x higher than female)
Homelessness (approx. 90% male)
Education (boys have been failing at every level since the 1990s)
Domestic Violence (40% victims are male)
False Allegations of Abuse
Disparity in health funding (prostate v breast cancer)
More information: https://ministerformen.wordpress.com

attributes.action: Parliament to debate accountability & efficacy of Sharia Councils under UK law.
attributes.background: Sharia law varies in interpretation within Islam but tends to be male dominated and discriminates against vulnerable women who may not be aware of their rights under civil law, Parliament to consider any legal incompatibilities between Sharia and UK law and how vulnerable women can be protected.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament are aware of concerns that Sharia Councils may make different judgements after civil courts have made their judgements and vulnerable women may feel peer pressure to comply with theocratic law. We pride ourselves on equality and one law for all, regardless of gender or religion but in practice all women do not access it.

attributes.action: Paediatric mental health training within the NHS medical staff
attributes.background: The issue is that the paediatric medical staff (NHS) doesn't know how to deal with mental health at all when a child is admitted to the ward for observation, with mental health training the staff  would be able to provide a better duty of care. (See additional details for a personal story)
attributes.additional_details:
Backround:
The reason for this petition is that my child has multiple mental illnesses and has been hospitalised as a result of this 5 times in 2017, when at the emergency department a lot of the staff was unsure what to do, they just sent the child up to the paediatric ward to be in overnight until CAMHS would arrive. However in all instances the staff was unsure what to do.

attributes.action: Scrap the 25% overseas transfer charge expats pay on QROPS pensions
attributes.background: Expats pay the charge on moving pensions from the UK to a QROPS or between QROPS unless they live in Europe or one of 13 countries which have QROPS outside Europe, which is unfair to the thousands who cannot access a QROPS pension where they live
attributes.additional_details: The overseas transfer charge discriminates against expats outside the EEA in a country which does not host a QROPS, making them pay a 25% exit tax on moving their pension fund from the UK to a QROPS to gain better financial terms. The charge is unreasonable as the rules punish QROPS members for financial planning when savers with other pensions, like Self-Invested Personal Pensions (SIPPs), can live in the same place as a QROPS saver and suffer no transfer charge on moving their fund

attributes.action: Axe Safety Tax, remove VAT on safety products & services for residential homes
attributes.background: Residential safety products & services are taxed at 20%, such items include: smoke alarms; annual gas safety checks; fire blankets; carbon monoxide detectors. Despite still being part of the EU, the Government does have the ability to axe the tax on these lifesaving products and services.
attributes.additional_details: These are potentially life-saving products and they should be affordable. http://safetytax.org.uk #axesafetytax

attributes.action: Change ethnicity classification of people of African & Caribbean descent in UK.
attributes.background:
I believe Africans and Caribbeans should not be referred to as Black British with a focus on the word "Black".

The right term should be either African British or Caribbean British just like we have Asian British etc.
attributes.additional_details: The word 'Black' has a negative connotation to it and should be removed from any reference made to and about Africans or Caribbeans.

attributes.action: Remove fees for basic RGN nurse training and teach them in nursing schools.
attributes.background:
The NHS is unable to recruit sufficient nurses and many potential nurses are put off by university / diploma debts. 
Increase the student nurse uptake by paying a basic salary and contract them to work for the trust that trained them for 6 months once qualified.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the schools of nursing were removed from our teaching hospitals the number of people coming into nursing has declined. In 1990 student nurses made up a THIRD of the NHS workforce, once Project 2000 was introduced the quality and number of student nurses steadily slipped.
Nursing at degree level entry means the NHS has lost thousands of potentially fabulous nurses because those that want to nurse cannot afford to train. 
We need excellent basic nursing care skills before we need a degree!

attributes.action: Bring back the death penalty for proved child rapists
attributes.background: Thousands of children get raped each year and even after time in jail, the offenders repeat the same offenses. Children's lives need to be more protected.

attributes.action: Require train seats in new trains to be more comfortable
attributes.background: The Government must undertake an urgent reassessment of the comfort of seating in new trains, including services between England and Scotland.  It must require the relevant rolling stock companies to refurbish seats to improve passenger comfort, within the confines of current EU standards.
attributes.additional_details:
Already influential voices within the Rail industry are expressing concern at the new seats. At a time the Government is urging people to reduce carbon footprints and use alternatives to cars, whereas seats on buses are getting more sumptuous and comfortable, seats on new trains are far less welcoming and comfortable than they were 50 years ago.

It's not too late to pressurise the Government to change the seats, the cost will be absorbed by those passengers who don't desert the railway for good.

attributes.action: Stop Southeastern Trains (Govia) from being awarded  franchise renewal.
attributes.background:
Southeastern / Govia have bid to renew their contract from December 2018.  
Despite making a £150 million profit they offer a poor and unacceptable service to their passengers.
Transport Secretary needs to be aware of how bad the service provided by Southeastern is.
attributes.additional_details:
- Daily repetitive train delays
- Unfair practice to stop delay repay
- Difficulty in applying for delay repay
- Short formed trains daily 
- Lack of working and clean toilets 
- % of cancelled trains daily 
- Lack of communication to passengers for delayed trains 
- Conflicting information to passengers 
- The Lewisham stranded train fiasco
- Increasing costs for a service which is decreasing and not acceptable for what passengers / commuters pay

attributes.action: Introduce a new Act of Parliament to protect freedom of religion and belief.
attributes.background: Freedom of religion and belief in the UK is under attack. It is time for a new generation to rise up and reclaim this great heritage of religious freedom and for the UK Parliament to pass a new Act affirming our religious freedom.
attributes.additional_details: The UK led the world in developing freedom of religion, and in spreading the idea of religious freedom around the world. Today, that heritage is being turned upside down and we are turning our backs on our history. We are seeing an increasingly intolerant secular humanism and anti-Christian prejudice, often called Christianophobia, in the UK. We need to tackle this violence and prejudice towards practising Christians in the UK.

attributes.action: Make cervical scans compulsory for anyone that has received cervical treatment
attributes.background: In Feb 2012 I underwent a LLETZ procedure to remove CIN 2 pre-cancerous cells from my cervix. When I fell pregnant in October 2014 I had an appointment with a medical registrar who advised there would be no effect on my pregnancy. In March 2015 my waters broke at 24 weeks & my son passed away.
attributes.additional_details:
At the time nobody was aware of what had caused my waters to break as I had received no monitoring during my pregnancy. Had I received cervical scans like I did in my subsequent pregnancy they would have been able to diagnose me with Incompetent Cervix & put a stitch in to save my son. 

Due to the amount of cells that were removed I was deemed to be 'low risk'. So if a low risk patient can lose a child then anybody can and this is totally unnecessary heartbreak that could have been prevented.

attributes.action: Enact New UK Legislation to Ban Food Waste
attributes.background: No country in Europe wastes as much food as the UK, despite millions of children, homeless and vulnerable people sleeping hungry at night. In 2016 France banned food waste and made it compulsory for supermarkets to donate unsold food to charities. We urge the UK government to enact a similar law.
attributes.additional_details: The £17 billion of food thrown away in the UK (WRAP). In the last 5 years, homelessness has also doubled and three million school children also risk hunger. Inspiringly, France has passed a law to ban food waste with fines and imprisonment for defaulters. In the UK, too, nutritious rescued food can feed the homeless and children in schools. The Government must uphold the right to food for every citizen and urgently pass a strong law to tackle food poverty and food waste.

attributes.action: Create Constituents' Charter & Independent Ombudsman re: Complaints About MPs
attributes.background: At the moment, there is no definition of an MP's legal duties and obligations to their constituents. Of course, most do their jobs very well, but some do not. And at the moment, there is virtually nothing anyone can do about such 'rogue' MP's. That is why we want Parliament to:
attributes.additional_details:
1. Create a Constituents' Charter which will;
2. Define the legal obligations an MP has toward their constituents
3. Provide a clear legal definition of a 'legitimate' query
4. Require MPs to answer all 'legitimate' constituent queries
5. Define strict time limits for MP replies
6. Include an Independent Ombudsman for Complaints Against MPs

attributes.action: Grant junior doctors the same maternity/paternity rights as other employees
attributes.background: The junior doctor contract allows doctors on mat leave to be moved to a different hospital, risking being placed 100s of miles from their old job, with insufficient warning for childcare planning and despite vacancies in their previous hospital. Other professions are protected from this by UK law.
attributes.additional_details: Junior doctors taking maternity leave are having the location of their employment changed drastically on returning to work, often making it unfeasible to continue training. Morale is already low and this can cause added stress and anxiety to doctors with young families. There is a staffing crisis across the NHS and so it would be in the public's interest to close this loophole and allow junior doctors the same parental rights as other employees, to increase junior doctor retention in the NHS.

attributes.action: Order for a new and updated Family Justice Review Report to be completed.
attributes.background: The last Family Justice Review was filled in November 2011. Almost 7 years ago. A new Family Justice Review is long overdue and a new updated report should be conducted to further improve the Family Justice System.
attributes.additional_details: The last and Final Family Justice Review Report was completed by Mr Norgove in November 2011. The government should now consider a new and updated Family Justice Review Report to be completed. There are many changes and improvements that could be discussed for instance; Fathers are not granted automatic parental responsibility like mothers are. The impact of Parental Alienation abuse and how the Justice system intends to address this. Further ways to encourage and facilitate contact for children

attributes.action: Petition for annual increase for pensioners outside the EU Block.
attributes.background: My pension has been deferred for 5 years, by various Governments and now I find, I will not get yearly pension rises, because I am not in an EU country!

attributes.action: Stop UK coastal crude oil pollution threat; ban Colter offshore oil rig.
attributes.background: The oil rig four miles off Bournemouth beach must be stopped and the Government should commit to a permanent ban on all offshore drilling in the area. Bournemouth, Poole and the wider coastal area is reliant on tourism and the natural beauty of the coast.
attributes.additional_details: A blowout could result in 20,000,000 gallons of leaked oil over thousands of square miles, devastating UK coasts, and their economies. Drilling offshore Bournemouth is a reckless gamble with our precious coastlines. It does not meet ALARP (as low as reasonably practicable) principles because there is an alternative - a nearby land-based extended reach drilling facility, where an oil spill could be contained and considerably reduced compared to a subsea leak directly into the sea.

attributes.action: Abolish all subsidies for shotgun and firearms licences
attributes.background: The cost for a shotgun licence and renewal currently does not cover the full costs of licensing, leaving the public to pick up the shortfall. This is clearly unacceptable, especially when you consider that the majority of us have no interest in killing animals for enjoyment
attributes.additional_details: The cost of a firearms licence has, for some reason, barely risen since 2001. The cost of a shotgun licence renewal is £49 but police forces put the cost of administration at around £200, leaving already stretched police forces, and of course ourselves, with unnecessary costs. The full cost of administrating licensing should be borne by the license holders.

attributes.action: Save the Borough of Poole.
attributes.background: We object to the proposed Future Dorset merger of Poole with adjacent councils. The public consultation was entirely flawed and Poole council's vote approving the merger was too narrowly based for such a sudden, profound and unnecessary reform. The residents of Poole do not want this merger.
attributes.additional_details:
The public consultation of 2016 was undebated, poorly advertised, designed simply to yield support for the plan and supported by analysis containing egregious errors.
The council decision showed a lack of unanimity for the abolision of a centuries-old borough. It was was not supported by any opposition councillors while the ruling group worked unreasonably to prevent any dissent within its own ranks.
The financial reasons used to justify the merger are erroneous and grossly misleading.

attributes.action: Change religious slaughter law to mirror the licensing requirements in Germany
attributes.background: Change the laws to mirror those in Germany as outlined in House of Commons Library SN07108SES dated 18/02/2015. Germany requires licensing and the matching of volumes produced to actual needs for religious slaughtered products.Britain has no such defined requirement for monitoring or enforcement
attributes.additional_details:
House of Commons SN07108 dated 28/02/2015
DEFRA T02017 and RFI 9592
Volume of meat produced by religious slaughter over 50%
Religious groups requiring such produce 6%
Most meat on sale in UK supermarkets carry EEC codes that refer to establishments that practice religious slaughter but there is no requirement to restrict the sale or even label these products which denies british consumers choice and infringes on the religious freedoms of groups who religions forbid its use

attributes.action: The Government to take the UK out of the ECJ & end free movement in March 2019
attributes.background: The government have been given a mandate by the people of the UK. If we have not left the jurisdiction of the ECJ after March 2019 then we have not left the EU. We also mandated you to stop free movement. If not enforced correctly, this would be a denial of the peoples democratic vote.

attributes.action: Ban low letterboxes in UK on new build
attributes.background: I would like to see the UK Government amend building regulations & ban low letterboxes as has been the case in Ireland Since January 1st 2001
attributes.additional_details:
Letter  boxes should be postman friendly..Low boxes can cause serious injury when you have quite a few in a row or on a round whilst carrying a sack of mail.
 Even just one low letterbox is one too many.. You wouldn't put the keyhole down there so why put the letterbox down there.

attributes.action: Increase Policing in Coventry
attributes.background: We are concerned about high levels of crime and lack of policing in the area. Therefore we call on the Home Secretary to give more resources to the West Midlands Police Force and Coventry in particular.

attributes.action: Increase the maximum prison sentence for animal cruelty to 10 years.
attributes.background: Sadly humans are not treated the same as other animals. This is completely wrong and this must be changed. So changing the prison sentence to 10 years will start to give all animals the rights they need.
attributes.additional_details: Right now the maximum prison sentence for animal cruelty is 6 months. There are plans to increase it to 5 years. This doesn’t go far enough, it needs to be 10 years.

attributes.action: Create a Charter for Families Bereaved through Public Tragedy
attributes.background: The Bishop's review of Hillsborough families' experiences recommends the creation of a Charter for Families Bereaved through Public Tragedy. The Government must implement this recommendation. This petition was started by bereaved relatives of family members who perished in the Grenfell Tower fire.
attributes.additional_details: The Charter will include commitments by public bodies to change in relation to transparency and acting in the public interest. By adopting this, the Government will show that it has learned the lessons of the Hillsborough disaster and ensure that the perspective of bereaved families is never lost. We’re concerned that the Grenfell public inquiry isn’t taking into account the views of bereaved families, survivors, and local community affected. They can be spared the indignities, pain and suffering Bishop James Jones describes in his report as "The Patronising disposition of unaccountable power".

attributes.action: Rebuild the “Hereford, Hay and Brecon” and “Mid-Wales” railways
attributes.background: The Beeching cuts of the 1960s closed a significant number of lines in the Marches and mid-Wales, the return of which would boost the economy and vitality of the area. There would also be a potential reduction in road traffic and therefore of carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Provide statutory anonymity for victims of homophobic & transphobic hate crime.
attributes.background: Being 'outed' is a barrier for victims to LGB&T hate crime reporting an incident to the Police and later attending court. Introducing statutory anonymity, as already given to victims of serious sexual assault, would remove this barrier, as well as removing the possibility of hostile media reporting.
attributes.additional_details:
1. LGB & T Hate Crime Reporting: Identifying Barriers and Solution, Equality Human Rights Commission (2015), page 31.
2. The Hate Crime Report: Homophobia, biphobia and transphobia in the UK, GALOP (2016), pages 8 - 9.
3. Homophobic Hate Crime: the Gay British Crime Survey (2013) pages 18 - 19.

attributes.action: Introduce a carbon tax on applicable products to help battle climate change.
attributes.background: Introduce a tax on products that are increasing the levels of carbon dioxide in the earths atmosphere. Offset the tax by reducing others on products/services that are better for the environment making it financially beneficial for people to make the right decisions on what they buy.
attributes.additional_details: This kind of tax would be similar to car tax in the way that an engine with lower emission levels is cheaper than one that has a higher level, and cars such as those powered by electricity have zero tax. This would make healthier foods more attainable to people and junk food more expensive, thus improving the publics health reducing the strain on services like the NHS. Another example, electricity provided by companies using renewable technologies would be cheaper than those using fossil fuels.

attributes.action: Incorporate LGBT+ history in primary and secondary school education
attributes.background: By introducing education of LGBT+ history, promoting LGBT+ equality and diversity and the normalisation of same-sex relationships in primary and secondary schools, we can work with children across the UK to help fight and prevent discriminating, and encouraging acceptance in future generations.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for anyone to cover their face in public places
attributes.background: Face covering is a security risk, It would help prevent the steep rise in violent crime, prevent anonymity in marauding gangs and facilitate identification. Exception can be made for safety helmets while driving, and face coverings authorised by a doctor for medical reasons.
attributes.additional_details: In many Muslim countries women do not cover their faces. Security ID can be fooled by a face mask. This request is intended for the security of all including minorities.

attributes.action: Stop mortgage interest support benefit changes.
attributes.background:
Next April the mortgage interest benefits support change to become a loan. This will make life even more difficult for the claimants relying on this benefit.

It means that more people could lose their homes, in turn needing to find rental properties and claiming housing benefits.

attributes.action: Ban balloon and sky / chinese lantern releases.
attributes.background: In 2013 the Government commissioned a study on balloons & sky lanterns. This report is now out of date! In March 2017 MCS reported 53% increase in balloon litter, upon 2015. 'Biodegradable' balloons and ribbons snare/kill farm, wild & marine life and take years to rot.
attributes.additional_details:
Sky lanterns are dangerous - they cause fire & damage & a risk to life. The NFU, MCS & 50 local councils want balloon/sky lantern releases banned!

2013 UK Government DEFRA & Welsh Government Report: http://bit.ly/2GcuEU0

Time to back balloon releases
http://www.xray-mag.com/content/time-back-banning-balloon-releases

Marine Conservation Society Information Sheet
https://www.mcsuk.org/downloads/pollution/dont%20let%20go.pdf

‘Nowhere is safe’: Young horse panicked by helium balloon suffers broken neck: http://bit.ly/2oV72r4

Farmer wins compensation after Red Nose Day balloon kills cow
http://bit.ly/2pu813a

Smethwick fire: Chinese lantern 'caused largest blaze'
http://bbc.in/2FY6SaX

Bunch of balloons in Billericay halts trains in their tracks http://bbc.in/2BSrdjy

attributes.action: Decriminalise, legalise and regulate cannabis for medicinal and recreational use
attributes.background:
The use of illegal drugs, impacts on the social and economic well being of the country, including its reputation overseas. 

The Government’s organised crime strategy sets out that drug trafficking to the UK costs an estimated £10.7 billion per year. (National Crime Agency, 2018).
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis is still the most widely used illegal drug in the UK and the UK wholesale cannabis market is worth almost £1 billion a year. The NCA estimates that 270 tonnes of cannabis is needed to satisfy annual UK user demand. (National Crime Agency, 2018).

www.nationalcrimeagency.gov.uk

The number of arrests and court cases associated with cannabis-related offences have declined substantially in the states that have legalized cannabis. (World Drug Report, 2016). 

www.unodc.org/wdr2016/

attributes.action: Ban paper receipts in the UK unless specifically requested by the customer.
attributes.background: Over 11 billion receipts are printed each year in the UK alone. The majority of these are discarded straight to the bin. This has a devastating effect on our environment and the future of our planet. We must stop receipts being handed out as a matter of habit and dramatically reduce this number.
attributes.additional_details: We live in a digital age where a receipt can be emailed at the click of a button. Eventually we should be phasing out paper receipts altogether, but for now the government need to take the first step of making it illegal for all shops and companies to hand out receipts without a customer specifically requesting one.

attributes.action: Create a UK Register for  people convicted of Animal Cruelty, Abuse & Neglect
attributes.background: Please sign in support of a 'UK Animal Offenders Register', a central database which will consist of name, address and convictions of people who have been convicted of any form of animal cruelty and abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
The Public and Breeders / sellers of animals will be able  to check this central database. If it is found that someone who has been convicted of animal cruelty or abuse has a animal the supplier / breeder will be held liable and prosecuted. 
At the moment there is no law to stop anyone who has been convicted of animal cruelty doing this again elsewhere.
Stricter laws need to be implemented to help protect animals, heavier fines & longer prison sentences as well as a Animal Offenders Register.

attributes.action: Allow and run a referendum in Wales to decide the future of the Welsh Assembly.
attributes.background: Over the past 20 years the many in Wales have become dissatisfied by the unnecessary bureaucracy known as the Welsh Assembly (WA).  Due to its ineffective and costly intervention at all levels of Welsh life it's time to have another referendum to allow us to decide if the WA should continue or not.
attributes.additional_details: There are many reasons why the Welsh Assembly (WA) should be dissolved.  These include excessive running costs each year.  A growing North/South Wales divide in terms of investment.  Anything that the WA does could be done by Welsh MPs in government.  The WA has gone against the wishes of Wales on leaving the EU. It appears to be nothing but a talking shop for already failed ideas and now wants to take on the role of government imposing laws and taxes that would further divide us from the UK.

attributes.action: Introduce a 10p disposable cup tax in the UK
attributes.background: Based on the success of the single use plastic bag tax of October 2015, a single use cup tax would help encourage more people to switch to reusable coffee cups, further reducing the UK's plastic waste output.
attributes.additional_details:
Michael Gove, Twitter, 6:37pm 20/11/17:
"Still haunted by last night's #BluePlanet2 - the imperative to do more to tackle plastic in our oceans is clear. We @DefraGovUK will work urgently to identify further action."

Many coffee shops like Costa and Starbucks offer customers the option to provide their own cup, usually encouraged by a small discount. This incentive, combined with the extra cost of a cup tax, should encourage many people to make a small sustainable change.

attributes.action: Revise and implement strategies to improve the quality of life for care leavers
attributes.background:
From foster care to independence, the support care leavers receive is automatically reduced, and their voice is no longer heard. This makes it increasingly difficult for care leavers to progress into adulthood, compared to young people who grew up with their birth parents. 

This needs to change.

attributes.action: Make removing items from a grave without permission illegal
attributes.background: We are creating this petition on behalf of all grieving parents and families who would like to decorate their child's grave, without the risk that cemetery staff may remove items without getting  permission from the family.
attributes.additional_details: We lost our baby girl Niamh at 22 weeks and 4 days and wanted to lay her to rest in a place where she wouldn't be disturbed by cemetery staff removing her belongings for health and safety reasons, in case the lawnmower ran the stones over and caused an interference or, in the words of the cemetery manager, "caused a death".

attributes.action: Make it illegal to wear service medals that you have not been awarded.
attributes.background: I am a Veteran of the Northern Ireland troubles and the Falklands War 1982. In both conflicts I lost friends. They did not see the medals that they had earned. It annoys me to see anybody wearing medals that they have not earned. I find it disrespectful to my friends and all the others who gave all.
attributes.additional_details: We are asked to sign a blank cheque, up to the value of our life. For this we may get a medal. To see somebody walking around wearing medals, who didn't serve or sign on, is disgusting. They have never put their life on the line. They have never been on active service and faced the enemy. Why should they be allowed to bring contempt upon the uniform of somebody who has come forward and protected the people of this country?

attributes.action: Ban the use of all non-recyclable packaging materials by 31st December 2020.
attributes.background:
It's crazy that we are still buying products with mixed packaging materials where part of it is recyclable and part of it not. 
I believe this means we recycle significantly less than we could as some people do not bother to sort it and just throw everything into the general rubbish.
attributes.additional_details: The need to reduce the use of landfill and to increase recycling is widely accepted and I believe this would be a major step forward to making a greener more sustainable future for our country and the world

attributes.action: Make domestic abusers sign a register
attributes.background: Domestic abuse will affect 1 in 4 women and 1 in 6 men in their lifetime and leads to, on average, two women being murdered each week and 30 men per year. By getting domestic abusers to sign a register, this could at least warn people before they decide to continue in a relationship with someone.
